text:
<@U7SL518D6> thanks but does that mean I need to create the whole backend and frontend from scratch? Is not there a way to use some ready made blocks of HubSpot(sections, buttons etc) or maybe an online editor for creating the app?
My concern is if I create it from scratch the frontend UI would be hard to match with HubSpot.

Hi all, does anyone know how can i make a header menu in HubSpot withou hardcoding the routes? I have some issues when i link the pages that way. Is there a HubSpot way to make the header section and the footer links?

You can <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/set-up-your-site-s-navigation-menus#:~:text=Create%20a%20new%20menu&text=In%20your%20HubSpot%20account%2C%20click,of%20an%20advanced%20menu%20module.|create navigation form settings> and then using <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags#menu|menu function> you can load html structure and stylise as you want, does this is the answer of your question ??
